revised_title: Regulation of Nicotinic Acetylcholine Receptor-Channel by the C-Kinase System
tldr: The article explores how acetylcholine may regulate its own nicotinic receptor-channel through the C-kinase system. The researchers used patch-clamp techniques on chick embryo myotubes and found that substances like 12-O-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate (TPA) and exogenous phospholipase C altered the conductance and gating behavior of the ACh-activated channel. They propose that acetylcholine regulates its own receptor-channel through PKC stimulation.
